examples: One of them got stuck in a chokehold and got stabbed to death during the fight .

definitions.definition: A physical confrontation or combat between two or more people or groups.
examples: Watch your language! Are you looking for a fight ?

definitions.definition: A boxing or martial arts match .
examples: I’m going to Nick’s to watch the big fight tomorrow night.

definitions.definition: A conflict , possibly nonphysical, with opposing ideas or forces; strife .
examples: I’ll put up a fight to save this company.

definitions.definition: The will or ability to fight.
examples: That little guy has a bit of fight in him after all.   As soon as he saw the size of his opponent, all the fight went out of him.

definitions.definition: A screen for the combatants in ships; an arming .

secondary_definitions: ( archaic ) A battle between opposing armies.
A physical confrontation or combat between two or more people or groups.
( sports ) A boxing or martial arts match .
A conflict , possibly nonphysical, with opposing ideas or forces; strife .
( uncountable ) The will or ability to fight.
( obsolete ) A screen for the combatants in ships; an arming .
